page.title: 02Swineshead, Developement
page.content: There are no shops in Swineshead but the village is well served by mobile shops, there is a post office and a pub. The centrepiece of the village is the church of St Nicholas. There has been a church in Swineshead since the 12th century the present church being completed in the 14th century. The church is undergoing extensive restoration at the moment and the village is busy organising various fund raising events to boost funds. Over the last few centuries very little development has taken place. In fact it is a smaller village in 1985 than it was 100 years ago. Quite a few of the cottages have disappeared and the emphasis has changed from a predominantly farming community to a commuter village. Even so Swineshead still has a village spirit and a timeless feel about it.
